messages.message: Hey all. I just started on Monday and am running through the dev env setup guide. I've run into issues with Python 3.7.3 (and 3.7.9, 3.8.10, and 3.91) on my M1 Mac. Is there a known path here? Should I be using the `arch -x86_64` approach with homebrew or is there a native path?

Eng has not yet moved onto M1, we tried using the last gen of laptops and the biggest blocker was docker wasn’t supported yet which is required for building our stack. It looks they’re working on it? https://docs.docker.com/desktop/mac/apple-silicon/

but it still sounds quite experimental and unstable
```However, attempts to run Intel-based containers on Apple silicon machines under emulation can crash as qemu sometimes fails to run the container. In addition, filesystem change notification APIs (inotify) do not work under qemu emulation. Even when the containers do run correctly under emulation, they will be slower and use more memory than the native equivalent.

In summary, running Intel-based containers on Arm-based machines should be regarded as "best effort" only. ```

Hmm.. This will become problematic quickly as Apple doesn't build Intel macs anymore. That's said, it's likely to be a non-trivial effort; python itself has issues with M1 support coming in only at 3.8.10/3.9.1. I'll look for another solution, then. Thanks.
